title: Data Scientist I
description: IGT (NYSE:IGT) is a global leader in gaming. We deliver entertaining and responsible gaming experiences for players across all channels and regulated segments, from Lotteries and Gaming Machines to Sports Betting and Digital. Leveraging a wealth of compelling content, substantial investment in innovation, player insights, operational expertise, and leading-edge technology, our solutions deliver unrivaled gaming experiences that engage players and drive growth. We have a well-established local presence and relationships with governments and regulators in more than 100 countries around the world, and create value by adhering to the highest standards of service, integrity, and responsibility. IGT has approximately 10,500 employees. For more information, please visit www.igt.com .Over viewIGT’s Center of Data Excellence is seeking a Data Scientist to research, design, and build innovative Analytics and Machine Learning (ML) solutions for the gaming industry. Working in close collaboration with our team of Data Engineers and Scientists, this role will also work in close collaboration with various business units to support data needs and data governance across many areas of IGT. It will have a large impact by performing innovative research studies and taking a hands-on, collaborative approach to implement the resulting outcomes.Responsibilities Work closely with other Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Data Owners to gain a high understanding of our gaming related data and business objectives  Manipulate and optimize large volumes of data from a variety of sources.  Work within a cloud-based infrastructure (AWS or Azure or Google Cloud and Snowflake)  Turn data into valuable and actionable insights.  Work collaboratively to identify highest value target areas to apply advanced analytics, statistical modeling, data mining and to help research new predictive models, scoring algorithms, and other analytical methods  Design, implement, and test statistical algorithms into production warehouses and reports  Responsibilities include working with various business units and cloud accounts, managing, and optimizing data retrieval, administration and automation  Partner with software developers to design, implement, and test analytically-sound software and user interfaces Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in computer science, applied math, computer engineering, or related field with Specific courses in data engineering, data science, and/or data analysis.  Drive and enthusiasm for data science, cloud technologies, AI analysis & modeling tools, and/or machine learning. Willing to try new things and help build a data management framework.  Strong math skills, analytics, statistics, and ability to deal with anomalies are essential  An understanding of business - specifically knowledge of gaming industry is considered an asset  Experience with Python, SQL, snowflake, AWS Sagemaker, Jupyter notebooks, data ingestion, data management, data modeling, documentation, data governance and/or data analytics  Experience with MS products preferred.  Experience with data manipulation and SQL and tools such as Hadoop, Kafka, and Spark……  Working knowledge of expert data mining, machine learning and predictive modeling skills such as decision trees, Markov chains, regressions, time series analysis, CNN  Exposure to or experience working with big data warehouses that can run Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) processes on top of big data sets using cloud-based infrastructure such as AWS or Azure or Google Cloud or Snowflake.  Experience working with software development teams is a plus Keys to Success Building collaborative relationships Decision making Drive results Foster innovation Personal energy Self-leadershipIGT is committed to sustaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of the global customers and communities we serve, creating a fair and inclusive culture that enables all our employees to feel valued, respected and engaged. IGT is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal opportunities without regard to sex, race, color, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or expression, marital or family status, and any other personal attributes protected by federal, provincial or other laws. We thank all applicants for applying; however, only those selected to interview will be contacted.IGT (NYSE: IGT) is the global leader in gaming. For more information, please visit www.igt.com .

title: Senior Software Engineer, Frontend
description: Company DescriptionKijiji is the #1 online classifieds site in Canada and one of Canada’s top 10 most-visited digital sites. We reach nearly half of Canadian internet users monthly. We’re a leader in helping users find and trade goods and services in their communities, including Autos, Real Estate and Jobs. We’re proud of our engaged, results-oriented and collaborative team and were recently named one of the top Toronto Tech Employer Brands.Kijiji is part of Adevinta: a global online classifieds specialist and sustainability leader with 40+ products in 14 countries.Job DescriptionAre you driven, ambitious, and inventive? Do you like to have fun? We love that culture and strive to nurture it every single day! We believe strongly in a culture of mentorship, support and mutual respect for all members of our team.As a Frontend Engineer, you’ll work on a full stack focused delivery team building new and exciting experiences for Kijiji users. You will be working in an Agile environment and using cutting edge frameworks and tools to craft code that delights users, as well as create tools that betters the system and supports our business.What You'll DoWork with your team to deliver well crafted, high quality, well-tested and scalable code.Participate in sprint planning and grooming sessions as an active member of the team.Work with product and UX to build features that improve our product and delight our usersFind a balance between short-term delivery and long-term scalability goals.Ensure code quality and maintainability by tackling tech debt, conducting code reviews, initiating refactoring and improving build and test systemsQualificationsWhat you'll have:4+ years of experience in software development3+ years of proven experience with JavaScript/TypeScriptDeep understanding of modern ReactKnowledge and experience with common web technologies (HTTP, REST, OAuth, CSS, GraphQL)Experience with Server Side Rendered frameworks like NextJSYou understand quality assurance as a task of the entire team to build the best experience to the usersIndependently and quick adoption of new technologies and conceptsEffective oral and written communication skillsWhat We OfferMeaningful work with diverse, international, highly skilled and passionate teams which give you the chance to make a difference in our customers’ lives.International career opportunities throughout Adevinta*.Competitive compensation, conference & education budget. We value your personal and professional development.A healthy work-life balance, i.e. part-time work, an additional paid parental leave time, flexible working hours including working from home options.A great atmosphere, open-minded company culture with several social team activities (online and offline).Additional InformationAdevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.Covid-19: We're reviewing the situation on a regular basis to ensure that we follow all local government guidelines and put the health of our people first. All interviews are currently taking place virtually.

title: Intern - Data Engineer
description: Summer Internship - Data EngineerLocation: Leamington, ONFull-time. Paid InternshipDuration: 15 weeks, May - August 2023About Tilray Brands, Inc.Tilray is a leading global cannabis-lifestyle and consumer packaged goods company with operations in Canada, the United States, Europe, Australia, and Latin America that is changing people's lives for the better – one person at a time – by inspiring and empowering the worldwide community to live their very best life by providing them with products that meet the needs of their mind, body, and soul and invoke a sense of wellbeing. Tilray’s mission is to be the trusted partner for its patients and consumers by providing them with a cultivated experience and health and wellbeing through high-quality, differentiated brands and innovative products. A pioneer in cannabis research, cultivation, and distribution, Tilray’s unprecedented production platform supports over 20 brands in over 20 countries, including comprehensive cannabis offerings, hemp-based foods, and alcoholic beverages.Looking to develop your career at the forefront of a rapidly expanding industry?Job SummaryThe Data Engineer Intern is responsible for preparing and cleansing data for analytics and machine learning operations around the company, while maintaining standards for accuracy and scalability required for a large global company.As a candidate for this role, you are passionate about learning new technologies, and implementing systems which unlock data for various stakeholders around the business. You are a self-starter but enjoy collaborating within a communicative and enthusiastic technical team. You also are personable and able to engage non-technical stakeholders with exciting technical solutions.Role And ResponsibilitiesAssist in the deployment of ETL and ELT data pipelines in an Azure environmentBuild and design Data Warehouse tables which fit stakeholder needs in a computationally efficient mannerQuickly troubleshoot and remediate errors due to source data changesEngage with stakeholders to gather requirements, and translate their needs into concrete, technically-sound solutionsProperly document and outline changes for an enterprise IT environmentCoding complex transformations using programming languages like PythonMaintaining and improving scripts and libraries used for data processing and deliveryQualifications And Education Requirements3rd year or beyond in University studying a technical subject including but not limited to Computer Science, Mathematics, or Data ScienceAbility to write and troubleshoot SQL queriesModerate knowledge of Python, and some familiarity with the major data processing libraries like pandas, dask, and pysparkFamiliarity with software engineering techniques and practices such as unit testing, CI/CD pipelines, containerized environments, and version controlKnowledge of cloud environments like Azure and AWS an assetExcellent problem solving skills; including the ability to quickly and accurately locate documentation via search engineAbility to help solve problems and develop solutions while working with stakeholders around the business Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodations for interviews or other meetings, please advise when submitting your application.Please note that Tilray does not authorize, engage, or sponsor any consultants, agencies or organizations that seek certain personal or financial information from you (e.g. passwords, login ids, credit card information). High Park does not charge any application, processing or onboarding fee at any stage of the recruitment or hiring process.When replying to emails, please ensure the sender name and email address match exactly. Please also ensure the Reply-To address matches the sending address exactly.If you are concerned about the authenticity of an email, letter, or call purportedly from, for, or on behalf of High Park, please send an email inquiry to infosec@tilray.com

title: ML Engineer
description: 2502021About PinterestMillions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that’s uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our PinFlex landing page to learn more. Pinterest is building a world-class shopping experience for our users; one of our top user requests is to be able to purchase the cool things they find on Pinterest. The Shopping Content Mining team in Toronto plays a critical role in this journey. Each Pin at Pinterest links to a URL, this team extracts helpful data like product prices and recipe ingredients from the HTML. The team manages the entire ML lifecycle, from labeling systems to model development to serving and measuring data quality ops. Our team consists of backend, frontend and ML engineers, along with a team of contractors to do labelling.The team’s ML Engineers research and develop ML systems to interpret webpages. This is a unique problem space with lots of possibilities for solutions including graph neural networks, NLP, computer vision and simple linear models. Our models are used to detect erroneous data, classify webpage types, and extract information. ML Engineers on our teams develop end to end solutions, from data gathering to model training and productionization.What You’ll DoDesign and build large scale ML systems that can process billions of webpagesTrain ML models to create representations of HTML pages, classify webpages and extract structured information from webpages.Create NLP systems to extract information from free form text and linkManage lifecycle and productionization of ML solutions, from data gathering to data quality management to measuring impact via experimentsDrive cross-functional collaborations with partner teamsHelp research novel solutions and present results via papers, blog posts or conference talksWhat We’re Looking For2+ years of industry experienceHands-on experience on large scale machine learning systems (full ML stack from modeling to deployment at scale.)Experience with production large scale serving or data systemsNice To HavePhD/Masters in Machine Learning or related areas, publication on top ML conferencesFamiliarity with information extraction techniques for web-pages and free-textsExperience working with shopping data is a plusThis position is not eligible for relocation assistance.Our Commitment To DiversityPinterest is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We want to have the best qualified people in every job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic under federal, state, or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you require an accommodation during the job application process, please notify accessibility@pinterest.com for support.

title: Machine Learning Developer
description: Who we areWe’re a thriving and agile tech development firm. People are at the center of everything we do. Simply put, we care. Our team personally cares about our clients and the world around them, and we care about our team’s life-long dreams, aspirations, and career development.We strongly believe in the power of community. This is why we seek opportunities to build meaningful relationships with everyone around us. We’re like a family, but with people from all over the world.We celebrate diversity in all its forms. Backgrounds, personalities, career paths, languages... you name it. We actively innovate, learn, and share stories around the topic. We want everyone to feel welcomed and included in all we do.We like having fun and enjoying ourselves. title: Software Engineer - AI
description: Welcome to Timbre!We are Timbre Games (part of the Sumo Digital Group), a new studio in Vancouver, Canada focused on making exciting, innovative game experiences. Timbre’s vision is to change the games industry through the original games we make, as well as how we make them. We’re building an inclusive, supportive culture that allows us to explore fresh, new (and sometimes weird) ideas. We’re searching for more visionary explorers to join our team of diverse voices, coming together to develop games that are accessible to a wide audience.If you’re thinking about your next adventure, send us your resume to talk to our team about how you can add your voice to the games we’re working on.Engineering at Timbre Games An Engineer at Timbre games will focus on creative, innovative and technically sound work. Our engineering team is fully integrated with all areas of game development and collaborates both technically and creatively. Our studio focuses on Unreal Engine 5, pushing everything we do towards technical excellence. We are lifelong learners, leaning on both internal expertise and external inspiration to continue our path of growth and development. We have a keen eye for best practices and elegant code, and ensure knowledge sharing, and mentoring are a priority.We value interdisciplinary collaboration and creative contributions. We're open to applications from individuals with at least one year of professional experience in games or other creative industries.AI Gameplay Engineers craft complex and diverse behaviors for our characters to delight and challenge our players. As An AI Gameplay Engineer At Timbre, You WillCollaborate with the game team to take ideas from prototype to production. Create smart and unpredictable AI that is exciting and fun to play with Develop core AI gameplay features, components, systems and tools Write beautiful and well documented C++ code that conforms to coding standards Communicate across multiple disciplines to mine the best behaviour ideas from the team What You BringA thorough understanding ofUnreal’s AI systems, working with Behaviour Trees, Blackboards and Custom Tasksto develop a range of behaviors. Experience developing AI behaviors on a shipped AAA title, or demonstrable experience with AI in Unreal Engine. An interest in the broader field of behavioral AI is a plus. What You'll GainTimbre aims to foster a workplace environment that empowers our team to do their best creative work. Below are a list of some of the benefits we offer to ensure you reach your full potential. As we continue to grow, we are co-creating more values-driven benefits to support our team. Competitive salary & comprehensive health benefits, including extended health, dental, vision, life and AD&D insurance, short / long-term disability, 24/7 counselling through an employee assistance program and a health spending account available to you from your first day Annual bonus & up to 5% RRSP matching available to you from your first day Flexible paid time off (unlimited), plus holiday closure between Christmas and New Years, as well as National Day for Truth and Reconciliation Work with us in Vancouver or remotely across Canada, utilizing our $500 work from home allowance 1 year gaming subscription and weekly gaming days My Pathway - a Career Development Program to provide a clear path for you to grow at Timbre 8 learning days per year and unlimited access to Udemy online courses A values driven culture with direct access to leadership and industry veterans with a wealth of knowledge to shareTimbre’s Commitment to Diversity and InclusionTimbre Games is located in beautiful Vancouver, BC, Canada and on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territories of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and Sel̓íl̓witulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations. Although our roots are in Vancouver, we work with a remote, distributed team across Canada. If you are interested in an opportunity at Timbre Games but are not presently residing in Canada, please note that we may be able to offer assistance in immigrating / relocating under the right conditions.Timbre Games is an equal opportunity employer and considers all candidates for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, marital status, military or veteran’s status (including protected veterans, as may be required by federal law), sexual orientation or any other category protected by law. We celebrate all backgrounds and attributes that make us unique and amazing - in this world and the ones we create!At Timbre, we try to be mindful and not set unrealistic requirement expectations in order to apply. If you don’t tick all of the boxes of the role that you’re excited about, we encourage you to send your resume to our General Application inbox on our careers page , or, follow Timbre on LinkedIn to stay in touch with our newest openings.Accommodations will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.If what we’ve shared above resonates with you, connect with us today!

title: Data Scientist/Analyst
description: The Hub Program at Client is modernizing its data reporting by improving user experience and introducing internal efficiencies, including the automation of indicator methodology calculations.Our Client's disclosures of health information are made at the highest degree of anonymity possible while still meeting the research and/or analytical purposes. Client publicly releases aggregated data in a manner designed to minimize any risk of re-identification and residual disclosure.Client is endeavouring to automate complex statistical disclosure controls (e.g. small cell-size suppression) to reduce the burden of their manual application, thereby introducing internal efficiencies and improve the timeliness of our reporting.ServicesAssess three statistical disclosure control tools (G-Confid, Tau-Argus and sdcTable) for their ability to meet Client's need to automate statistical disclosure control techniques (e.g. primary and complementary cell suppressions, rounding, etc) for a variety of multi-dimensional, linked and hierarchical aggregate data tables sourcing clinical databases and survey data, with the goal of minimizing disclosure risk while maximizing information utility. Conduct a proof of concept demonstrating the tools' features and capabilities using a variety of aggregate Client data tables, while highlighting how each of the tools could fit into operational data production processes.Write a report summarizing the findings and recommend which among these tools would best meet Client needs. Create plain-language documentation to support the application of preferred disclosure control techniques to aggregate data sets using the recommended tool. Knowledge transfer to support ongoing in-house operational application of the preferred statistical disclosure control techniques for future data releases.Skill or Knowledge Skill Required Skill Level *(Intermediate or Senior) COTS Configuration/Development SAS Macro Yes Intermediate SAS Programming Yes Intermediate Big Data Python Yes Intermediate R Yes Intermediate Leadership / Business Skills Analysis Yes Intermediate CIHI Business Understanding Yes Industry Best Practices/ Trends Yes Intermediate Problem-Solving Yes Senior Process Automation Yes Senior Verbal Communication Yes Intermediate Workflow Design Yes Intermediate Written Communication Yes Intermediate Coaching/ Mentoring Yes Intermediate Other G-Confid Yes Intermediate Tau-Argus Yes Intermediate sdcTable Yes Intermediate

title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
description: Company ProfileTTT Studios is a digital innovation studio working for a global client list in multiple industries. Over the past decade, we’ve built multiple applications and patented a portfolio of technologies. This experience has put us in the best position to cater to larger accounts and launch our products. Our culture is essential to our company, and we foster an open and welcoming environment for everyone on our team.We understand that success comes from sweating the details. Carefully considered design—whether in our user interface work, technical architectures, or project management processes—is at the core of everything we do. We expect amazing things from each other, and through tight collaboration, we achieve greatness.Candidates must be based in the Vancouver Area.About the Role - Senior AI/ML EngineerWe are seeking an experienced AI & ML Engineer to join our team and work on exciting projects using state-of-the-art technologies such as Language Model LLMs (e.g., GPT-3), chat GPT APIs, cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP), and model training (e.g., TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch).ResponsibilitiesDesign and develop AI & ML models using cutting-edge tools and techniques, including LLMs and chat GPT APIs.Work closely with the team to identify and solve complex business problems using machine learning and statistical models.Train and optimize models using cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP) and other distributed computing systems.Develop and maintain code repositories, documentation, and data pipelines using version control tools such as Git, and CI/CD tools such as Jenkins or TravisCI.Stay up-to-date with the latest research and trends in AI & ML, and bring new ideas and best practices to the team.RequirementsBachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.5+ years of experience in AI & ML, with a proven track record of developing and deploying models in production environments.Proficiency in Python and related AI & ML libraries, such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn.Hands-on experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT-3), chat GPT APIs, and other NLP tools and techniques.Strong understanding of cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP) and distributed computing systems, such as Kubernetes or Apache Spark.Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work in a team environment and interface with cross-functional teams.If you're passionate about AI & ML and have experience with cutting-edge technologies such as LLMs, chat GPT APIs, cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP), and model training (e.g., TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch), we'd love to hear from you. Join our team and work on cutting-edge projects that will shape the future of AI & ML!Hiring ProcessComplete this application and include your CVIf you’re shortlisted, we’ll schedule a video interview with our HR Manager.We will set up an interview at our office or via video conference. We'll talk about your experience, what you think about patterns, architecture, and some everyday situations while developing an app.We’ll schedule a final interview to give more team members a chance to meet youAfter conducting all interviews, we’ll come to a decision.A Day at TTT StudiosOur work culture is second to none. On your first day, you’ll be introduced to the team, and we’ll walk you through our onboarding process to get you set up with the tools we use company-wide. Once settled in, our PM team will get you up to speed with our operations, standards, project pipeline, and client roster. Soon after you’re equipped with the resources and support you’ll need, you’ll be ready to jump into action.Our clients operate across various industries that span professional services, startups, tourism, logistics, e-commerce, and more. For every project you take on, you’ll encounter intellectually stimulating and impactful challenges that will keep you on your toes. Check out some of our past work here.Our perks include a flexible wellness plan, work flexibility, unlimited vacation, happy hours, Lunch & Learns, yoga and boxing lessons, and a cozy massage chair overlooking Vancouver’s scenic waterfront. The team at TTT is passionate about creating software that makes a positive impact, and management does everything it can to plant the seeds that will propel you to greater heights.More from UsTTT Studios is an award-winning digital innovation studio focused on empowering businesses through technology. We’re ranked #1 in Canada for custom software and mobile application development. Our values are integrity, passion, and excellence. We’re obsessed with delivering quality work, which is why our team consists of designers and engineers of the highest calibre. We also strongly believe in empowering the community by being heavily involved in local and international events as speakers, educators, and sponsors. Whether you’re a developer, designer, management, or co-op student, everyone here contributes to who we are as a company.

title: ML-Ops Engineer
description: Position Overview:ShyftLabs is searching for an ML-Ops Engineer to join our expanding team. In this role, you will own our end-to-end Machine Learning platform and core infrastructure, from research to Machine Learning production pipelines. As an ML-Ops Engineer, you’ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. You should be self-directed and comfortable implementing training and inference pipelines in collaboration with a wide range of stakeholders and cross-functional teams. As an ideal candidate, you need to have a strong background in Machine Learning and software development. Must have Vertex AI experience.ShyftLabs is a growing data product company that was founded in early 2020, and works primarily with Fortune 500 companies. We deliver digital solutions built to help accelerate the growth of businesses in various industries, by focusing on creating value through innovation.Job Responsibilities:Design and implement large-scale ML systems to support training and serving workloads.Collaborating and share knowledge with our cloud ops team to compress time-to-production for Machine Learning.Build tooling and pipelining abstractions to allow Data scientists to focus on experimentation while empowering self-service workflows to deploy and serve models reliably and consistently.Help Data Scientists produce clean, reproducible, and highly performant machine learning systems through rigorous code review with a lens on software quality.Advocate for automation and monitoring at all steps of ML system construction, and help to define best practices based on personal industry experience and research across the Machine Learning team.Support life cycle management of deployed ML apps (e.g., new releases, change management, monitoring and troubleshooting).Participate in sprint planning, estimations, and reviews.Qualifications:3+ years of software development experience, preferably in Python.Experience with maintaining functional, production reference architectures for end-to-end Machine Learning in cloud.Must have experience with ML-Ops tools and platforms such as Vertex AI, MLFlow and DVC.Strong Linux system administration skills.Experience with declarative infrastructure and Kubernetes (GKE) for model serving and scalable inference.Exposure to automated testing and CI/CD in the ML context.Knowledge of SQL and relational databases, query authoring (SQL) and designing variety of databases (e.g., Postgres SQL).Understanding of fundamental ML concepts.Interest in continually learning and trying new tools.Strong cross-team communication and collaboration skills.We are proud to offer a competitive salary alongside a strong healthcare insurance and benefits package. The role is preferably hybrid, with 2 days per week spent in office. We pride ourselves on the growth of our employees, offering extensive learning and development resources.

title: CRM Data Scientist
description: Browns Shoes, a family-owned business established in Montreal in 1940, now with 70 stores across Canada, is synonymous with top international designer collections, luxurious leather goods, and exclusive street savvy fashion for ladies, men, and children.Browns is seeking a highly skilled and experienced customer database analyst to execute data science projects within our growing marketing team. As a CRM Data Scientist, reporting to the Director of CRM & Loyalty, you will be responsible for analysing and interpreting customer data to identify key insights, trends and relationships that can be used to improve our marketing segmentation strategies and boost overall cross-channel customer engagement.The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in building actionable data models to predict customer behaviour and testing our theories in a live business context to provide the best possible personalized experience for our customers.Responsibilities:Work with the marketing team to identify key business questions that can be addressed using data analysis and statistical modelling.Conduct in-depth analyses of customer data to create and validate audience segmentation based on user demographics, purchase behaviour, tastes, and preferences.Develop and implement predictive models to forecast customer behaviour and to identify customer trends and patterns, including customer lifetime value and churn analysis.Collaborate with cross-functional marketing teams to provide data-driven insights and recommendations to optimize the cross-channel customer journey.Design and develop dashboards and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.Collaborate with internal BI and Tech teams as the key “customer” of raw centralized data structures: operationalizing it to drive customer-facing action and to support marketing decision-making.Requirements:Bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.3+ years of experience in data analysis and statistical modelling.Proficiency with SQL queries and data analysis tools such as R and Python.Proficiency with CDP platforms such as Twillo Segment, Emarsys and Tealium; experience with Snowflake, AWS or BigQuery a plus.Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker and PowerBI.Knowledge of marketing segmentation techniques and customer database analysis.Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical information clearly.Ability to work independently on complex analytical projects with attention to detail and strong documentation practices.While we appreciate your interest in this role, please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.Thank you for your interest in BrownsChaussures Browns, une entreprise familiale fondée à Montréal en 1940, détient maintenant 70 boutiques partout au Canada. Nous offrons les meilleures marques internationales, des articles luxueux en cuir et des tendances urbaines exclusives pour hommes, femmes et enfants.Browns est à la recherche d'un analyste de base de données clients hautement qualifié et expérimenté pour exécuter des projets de science des données dans le cadre de notre équipe marketing en pleine croissance. En tant que Scientifique des données CRM, sous la responsabilité du Directeur CRM & loyauté, vous serez chargé d'analyser et d'interpréter les données clients afin d'identifier les informations clés, les tendances et les relations qui peuvent être utilisées pour améliorer nos stratégies de segmentation marketing et stimuler l'engagement global des clients à travers les différents canaux.Le candidat idéal doit s'intéresser fortement à l'élaboration de modèles de données exploitables pour prédire le comportement des clients et tester nos théories dans un contexte commercial réel afin d'offrir la meilleure expérience personnalisée possible à nos clients.Responsabilités:Travailler avec l'équipe de marketing pour identifier les questions commerciales clés qui peuvent être traitées à l'aide de l'analyse des données et de la modélisation statistique.Effectuer des analyses approfondies des données relatives aux clients afin de créer et de valider la segmentation du public en fonction des caractéristiques démographiques des utilisateurs, de leur comportement d'achat, de leurs goûts et de leurs préférences.Développer et mettre en œuvre des modèles prédictifs pour prévoir le comportement des clients et pour identifier les tendances et les modèles des clients, y compris la valeur de la durée de vie des clients et l'analyse du taux de désabonnement.Collaborer avec les équipes marketing interfonctionnelles pour fournir des informations et des recommandations basées sur des données afin d'optimiser le parcours client multicanal.Concevoir et développer des tableaux de bord et des rapports pour communiquer des informations aux parties prenantes.Collaborer avec les équipes BI et technologiques internes en tant que "client" clé des structures de données brutes centralisées : les rendre opérationnelles pour mener des actions en contact avec les clients et pour soutenir la prise de décision en matière de marketing.Exigences:Baccalauréat ou maîtrise en science des données, en statistiques, en mathématiques, en informatique ou dans un domaine connexe.3+ ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de données et la modélisation statistique.Maîtrise des requêtes SQL et des outils d'analyse de données tels que R et Python.Maîtrise des plateformes CDP telles que Twillo Segment, Emarsys et Tealium ; expérience avec Snowflake, AWS ou BigQuery un plus.Maîtrise des outils de visualisation de données tels que Tableau, Looker et PowerBI.Connaissance des techniques de segmentation marketing et de l'analyse des bases de données clients.Solides compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes et de réflexion critique, avec la capacité de communiquer clairement des informations techniques complexes.Capacité à travailler de manière autonome sur des projets analytiques complexes, avec un souci du détail et de solides pratiques de documentation.Nous avons hâte de recevoir votre candidature ; notez que nous communiquerons seulement avec les personnes retenues.Merci de l’intérêt que vous portez à Browns

We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. title: Software Engineer Internship in Big Data & Data Science tools
Intern - Data Engineer
description: Summer Internship - Data EngineerLocation: Leamington, ONFull-time. Paid InternshipDuration: 15 weeks, May - August 2023About Tilray Brands, Inc.Tilray is a leading global cannabis-lifestyle and consumer packaged goods company with operations in Canada, the United States, Europe, Australia, and Latin America that is changing people's lives for the better – one person at a time – by inspiring and empowering the worldwide community to live their very best life by providing them with products that meet the needs of their mind, body, and soul and invoke a sense of wellbeing. Tilray’s mission is to be the trusted partner for its patients and consumers by providing them with a cultivated experience and health and wellbeing through high-quality, differentiated brands and innovative products. A pioneer in cannabis research, cultivation, and distribution, Tilray’s unprecedented production platform supports over 20 brands in over 20 countries, including comprehensive cannabis offerings, hemp-based foods, and alcoholic beverages.Looking to develop your career at the forefront of a rapidly expanding industry?Job SummaryThe Data Engineer Intern is responsible for preparing and cleansing data for analytics and machine learning operations around the company, while maintaining standards for accuracy and scalability required for a large global company.As a candidate for this role, you are passionate about learning new technologies, and implementing systems which unlock data for various stakeholders around the business. You are a self-starter but enjoy collaborating within a communicative and enthusiastic technical team. title: Machine Learning Software Developer
description: Primate Labs, a small (but mighty!) software company located in Toronto, is looking for enthusiastic developers to join our team and help us build Geekbench ML, a machine learning benchmark that measures the performance of popular neural network accelerators.Our diverse customers, from individual consumers to Fortune 500 hardware companies, rely on us to provide applications that produce accurate and unbiased cross-platform performance assessments.The ideal candidate will thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and enjoy working within a small, tight-knit team.ResponsibilitiesAs a Machine Learning Developer, you will be responsible for researching, designing, and developing machine learning benchmark tests to measure the inference performance of neural network accelerators. The benchmark tests use different machine learning frameworks, including TensorFlow Lite and Core ML. The benchmark tests draw from machine learning applications, including object classification, image segmentation, pose estimation, machine translation, and sentiment analysis. In addition to developing the benchmark tests, you will communicate experimental results from the benchmark tests both internally to project stakeholders and externally to representatives from hardware and platform vendors.QualificationsWe're looking for candidates with the following background and skills:An understanding of neural networks and how they work.Experience with at least one machine learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, Core ML, ONNX).Experience with C++ and Python.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision.An undergraduate degree in a technical field.The following skills are nice to have but by no means necessary:Experience with Java, Objective-C, or Swift.Experience developing for Android or iOS.Compensation and BenefitsPrimate Labs offers a fun and exciting working environment with minimal bureaucracy. Compensation includes a competitive salary, generous vacation time, and medical and dental benefits.This role is a full-time hybrid role in our Toronto office.

title: ML Engineer
description: 2502021About PinterestMillions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that’s uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our PinFlex landing page to learn more. Pinterest is building a world-class shopping experience for our users; one of our top user requests is to be able to purchase the cool things they find on Pinterest. The Shopping Content Mining team in Toronto plays a critical role in this journey. Each Pin at Pinterest links to a URL, this team extracts helpful data like product prices and recipe ingredients from the HTML. The team manages the entire ML lifecycle, from labeling systems to model development to serving and measuring data quality ops. Our team consists of backend, frontend and ML engineers, along with a team of contractors to do labelling.The team’s ML Engineers research and develop ML systems to interpret webpages. This is a unique problem space with lots of possibilities for solutions including graph neural networks, NLP, computer vision and simple linear models. Our models are used to detect erroneous data, classify webpage types, and extract information. ML Engineers on our teams develop end to end solutions, from data gathering to model training and productionization.What You’ll DoDesign and build large scale ML systems that can process billions of webpagesTrain ML models to create representations of HTML pages, classify webpages and extract structured information from webpages.Create NLP systems to extract information from free form text and linkManage lifecycle and productionization of ML solutions, from data gathering to data quality management to measuring impact via experimentsDrive cross-functional collaborations with partner teamsHelp research novel solutions and present results via papers, blog posts or conference talksWhat We’re Looking For2+ years of industry experienceHands-on experience on large scale machine learning systems (full ML stack from modeling to deployment at scale.)Experience with production large scale serving or data systemsNice To HavePhD/Masters in Machine Learning or related areas, publication on top ML conferencesFamiliarity with information extraction techniques for web-pages and free-textsExperience working with shopping data is a plusThis position is not eligible for relocation assistance.Our Commitment To DiversityPinterest is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We want to have the best qualified people in every job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic under federal, state, or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you require an accommodation during the job application process, please notify accessibility@pinterest.com for support.

title: Data Scientist
description: Position Overview:Here at ShyftLabs, we are searching for an experienced Data Scientist who can derive performance improvement and cost efficiency in our product through a deep understanding of the ML and infra system, and provide a data driven insight and scientific solution.ShyftLabs is a growing data product company that was founded in early 2020, and works primarily with Fortune 500 companies. We deliver digital solutions built to help accelerate the growth of businesses in various industries, by focusing on creating value through innovation.Job Responsibilities:Data Analysis and research: analyzing a large dataset with queries and scripts, extracting valuable signals out of noise, and producing actionable insights into how we could complete and improve a complex ML and bidding system.Simulation and Modelling: validating and quantifying the efficiency and performance gain from hypotheses through rigorous simulation and modelling.Experimentation and Causal Inference: developing a robust experiment design and metric framework, and providing reliable and unbiased insights for product and business decision making.Qualifications:Master's degree in a quantitative discipline or equivalent.3+ years minimum professional experience.Distinctive problem-solving skills, good at articulating product questions, pulling data from large datasets and using statistics to arrive at a recommendation.Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with ability to present information and analysis results effectively.Ability to build positive relationships within ShyftLabs and with our stakeholders, and work effectively with cross-functional partners in a global company.Statistics: must have strong knowledge and experience in experimental design, hypothesis testing, and various statistical analysis techniques such as regression or linear models.Machine Learning: must have deep understanding of ML algorithms (i.e. deep learning, random forest, gradient boosted trees, k-means clustering, etc.) and its development, validation, and evaluation.Programming: experience with Python, R or other scripting language, and database language (e.g. SQL) or data manipulation (e.g. Pandas).We are proud to offer a competitive salary alongside a strong healthcare insurance and benefits package. title: Data Scientist/Analyst
description: The Hub Program at Client is modernizing its data reporting by improving user experience and introducing internal efficiencies, including the automation of indicator methodology calculations.Our Client's disclosures of health information are made at the highest degree of anonymity possible while still meeting the research and/or analytical purposes. Client publicly releases aggregated data in a manner designed to minimize any risk of re-identification and residual disclosure.Client is endeavouring to automate complex statistical disclosure controls (e.g. small cell-size suppression) to reduce the burden of their manual application, thereby introducing internal efficiencies and improve the timeliness of our reporting.ServicesAssess three statistical disclosure control tools (G-Confid, Tau-Argus and sdcTable) for their ability to meet Client's need to automate statistical disclosure control techniques (e.g. primary and complementary cell suppressions, rounding, etc) for a variety of multi-dimensional, linked and hierarchical aggregate data tables sourcing clinical databases and survey data, with the goal of minimizing disclosure risk while maximizing information utility. Conduct a proof of concept demonstrating the tools' features and capabilities using a variety of aggregate Client data tables, while highlighting how each of the tools could fit into operational data production processes.Write a report summarizing the findings and recommend which among these tools would best meet Client needs. Create plain-language documentation to support the application of preferred disclosure control techniques to aggregate data sets using the recommended tool. Knowledge transfer to support ongoing in-house operational application of the preferred statistical disclosure control techniques for future data releases.Skill or Knowledge Skill Required Skill Level *(Intermediate or Senior) COTS Configuration/Development SAS Macro Yes Intermediate SAS Programming Yes Intermediate Big Data Python Yes Intermediate R Yes Intermediate Leadership / Business Skills Analysis Yes Intermediate CIHI Business Understanding Yes Industry Best Practices/ Trends Yes Intermediate Problem-Solving Yes Senior Process Automation Yes Senior Verbal Communication Yes Intermediate Workflow Design Yes Intermediate Written Communication Yes Intermediate Coaching/ Mentoring Yes Intermediate Other G-Confid Yes Intermediate Tau-Argus Yes Intermediate sdcTable Yes Intermediate

title: Software Engineer - AI
description: Welcome to Timbre!We are Timbre Games (part of the Sumo Digital Group), a new studio in Vancouver, Canada focused on making exciting, innovative game experiences. Timbre’s vision is to change the games industry through the original games we make, as well as how we make them. We’re building an inclusive, supportive culture that allows us to explore fresh, new (and sometimes weird) ideas. We’re searching for more visionary explorers to join our team of diverse voices, coming together to develop games that are accessible to a wide audience.If you’re thinking about your next adventure, send us your resume to talk to our team about how you can add your voice to the games we’re working on.Engineering at Timbre Games An Engineer at Timbre games will focus on creative, innovative and technically sound work. Our engineering team is fully integrated with all areas of game development and collaborates both technically and creatively. Our studio focuses on Unreal Engine 5, pushing everything we do towards technical excellence. We are lifelong learners, leaning on both internal expertise and external inspiration to continue our path of growth and development. We have a keen eye for best practices and elegant code, and ensure knowledge sharing, and mentoring are a priority.We value interdisciplinary collaboration and creative contributions. We're open to applications from individuals with at least one year of professional experience in games or other creative industries.AI Gameplay Engineers craft complex and diverse behaviors for our characters to delight and challenge our players. As An AI Gameplay Engineer At Timbre, You WillCollaborate with the game team to take ideas from prototype to production. Create smart and unpredictable AI that is exciting and fun to play with Develop core AI gameplay features, components, systems and tools Write beautiful and well documented C++ code that conforms to coding standards Communicate across multiple disciplines to mine the best behaviour ideas from the team What You BringA thorough understanding ofUnreal’s AI systems, working with Behaviour Trees, Blackboards and Custom Tasksto develop a range of behaviors. Experience developing AI behaviors on a shipped AAA title, or demonstrable experience with AI in Unreal Engine. An interest in the broader field of behavioral AI is a plus. What You'll GainTimbre aims to foster a workplace environment that empowers our team to do their best creative work. Below are a list of some of the benefits we offer to ensure you reach your full potential. As we continue to grow, we are co-creating more values-driven benefits to support our team. Competitive salary & comprehensive health benefits, including extended health, dental, vision, life and AD&D insurance, short / long-term disability, 24/7 counselling through an employee assistance program and a health spending account available to you from your first day Annual bonus & up to 5% RRSP matching available to you from your first day Flexible paid time off (unlimited), plus holiday closure between Christmas and New Years, as well as National Day for Truth and Reconciliation Work with us in Vancouver or remotely across Canada, utilizing our $500 work from home allowance 1 year gaming subscription and weekly gaming days My Pathway - a Career Development Program to provide a clear path for you to grow at Timbre 8 learning days per year and unlimited access to Udemy online courses A values driven culture with direct access to leadership and industry veterans with a wealth of knowledge to shareTimbre’s Commitment to Diversity and InclusionTimbre Games is located in beautiful Vancouver, BC, Canada and on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territories of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and Sel̓íl̓witulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations. Although our roots are in Vancouver, we work with a remote, distributed team across Canada. If you are interested in an opportunity at Timbre Games but are not presently residing in Canada, please note that we may be able to offer assistance in immigrating / relocating under the right conditions.Timbre Games is an equal opportunity employer and considers all candidates for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, marital status, military or veteran’s status (including protected veterans, as may be required by federal law), sexual orientation or any other category protected by law. We celebrate all backgrounds and attributes that make us unique and amazing - in this world and the ones we create!At Timbre, we try to be mindful and not set unrealistic requirement expectations in order to apply. If you don’t tick all of the boxes of the role that you’re excited about, we encourage you to send your resume to our General Application inbox on our careers page , or, follow Timbre on LinkedIn to stay in touch with our newest openings.Accommodations will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.If what we’ve shared above resonates with you, connect with us today!

title: CRM Data Scientist
description: Browns Shoes, a family-owned business established in Montreal in 1940, now with 70 stores across Canada, is synonymous with top international designer collections, luxurious leather goods, and exclusive street savvy fashion for ladies, men, and children.Browns is seeking a highly skilled and experienced customer database analyst to execute data science projects within our growing marketing team. As a CRM Data Scientist, reporting to the Director of CRM & Loyalty, you will be responsible for analysing and interpreting customer data to identify key insights, trends and relationships that can be used to improve our marketing segmentation strategies and boost overall cross-channel customer engagement.The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in building actionable data models to predict customer behaviour and testing our theories in a live business context to provide the best possible personalized experience for our customers.Responsibilities:Work with the marketing team to identify key business questions that can be addressed using data analysis and statistical modelling.Conduct in-depth analyses of customer data to create and validate audience segmentation based on user demographics, purchase behaviour, tastes, and preferences.Develop and implement predictive models to forecast customer behaviour and to identify customer trends and patterns, including customer lifetime value and churn analysis.Collaborate with cross-functional marketing teams to provide data-driven insights and recommendations to optimize the cross-channel customer journey.Design and develop dashboards and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.Collaborate with internal BI and Tech teams as the key “customer” of raw centralized data structures: operationalizing it to drive customer-facing action and to support marketing decision-making.Requirements:Bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.3+ years of experience in data analysis and statistical modelling.Proficiency with SQL queries and data analysis tools such as R and Python.Proficiency with CDP platforms such as Twillo Segment, Emarsys and Tealium; experience with Snowflake, AWS or BigQuery a plus.Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker and PowerBI.Knowledge of marketing segmentation techniques and customer database analysis.Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical information clearly.Ability to work independently on complex analytical projects with attention to detail and strong documentation practices.While we appreciate your interest in this role, please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.Thank you for your interest in BrownsChaussures Browns, une entreprise familiale fondée à Montréal en 1940, détient maintenant 70 boutiques partout au Canada. Nous offrons les meilleures marques internationales, des articles luxueux en cuir et des tendances urbaines exclusives pour hommes, femmes et enfants.Browns est à la recherche d'un analyste de base de données clients hautement qualifié et expérimenté pour exécuter des projets de science des données dans le cadre de notre équipe marketing en pleine croissance. En tant que Scientifique des données CRM, sous la responsabilité du Directeur CRM & loyauté, vous serez chargé d'analyser et d'interpréter les données clients afin d'identifier les informations clés, les tendances et les relations qui peuvent être utilisées pour améliorer nos stratégies de segmentation marketing et stimuler l'engagement global des clients à travers les différents canaux.Le candidat idéal doit s'intéresser fortement à l'élaboration de modèles de données exploitables pour prédire le comportement des clients et tester nos théories dans un contexte commercial réel afin d'offrir la meilleure expérience personnalisée possible à nos clients.Responsabilités:Travailler avec l'équipe de marketing pour identifier les questions commerciales clés qui peuvent être traitées à l'aide de l'analyse des données et de la modélisation statistique.Effectuer des analyses approfondies des données relatives aux clients afin de créer et de valider la segmentation du public en fonction des caractéristiques démographiques des utilisateurs, de leur comportement d'achat, de leurs goûts et de leurs préférences.Développer et mettre en œuvre des modèles prédictifs pour prévoir le comportement des clients et pour identifier les tendances et les modèles des clients, y compris la valeur de la durée de vie des clients et l'analyse du taux de désabonnement.Collaborer avec les équipes marketing interfonctionnelles pour fournir des informations et des recommandations basées sur des données afin d'optimiser le parcours client multicanal.Concevoir et développer des tableaux de bord et des rapports pour communiquer des informations aux parties prenantes.Collaborer avec les équipes BI et technologiques internes en tant que "client" clé des structures de données brutes centralisées : les rendre opérationnelles pour mener des actions en contact avec les clients et pour soutenir la prise de décision en matière de marketing.Exigences:Baccalauréat ou maîtrise en science des données, en statistiques, en mathématiques, en informatique ou dans un domaine connexe.3+ ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de données et la modélisation statistique.Maîtrise des requêtes SQL et des outils d'analyse de données tels que R et Python.Maîtrise des plateformes CDP telles que Twillo Segment, Emarsys et Tealium ; expérience avec Snowflake, AWS ou BigQuery un plus.Maîtrise des outils de visualisation de données tels que Tableau, Looker et PowerBI.Connaissance des techniques de segmentation marketing et de l'analyse des bases de données clients.Solides compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes et de réflexion critique, avec la capacité de communiquer clairement des informations techniques complexes.Capacité à travailler de manière autonome sur des projets analytiques complexes, avec un souci du détail et de solides pratiques de documentation.Nous avons hâte de recevoir votre candidature ; notez que nous communiquerons seulement avec les personnes retenues.Merci de l’intérêt que vous portez à Browns

title: MLOps Software Engineer
description: Two years ago, we embarked on a journey to start Haven Studios with a small team and big ambitions. Our goal was to build a studio where we could make the kind of games we’ve always wanted to create – and games we’ve longed to play. We are now part of the Playstation Studios family and are building exclusive new IP for Playstation as the first Sony game studio in Canada.We’ve made amazing progress in a short time thanks to our talented, passionate team and their exceptional contributions. We established a culture at Haven grounded in kindness, adaptability and courage that unlocks creativity. Our first new IP for PlayStation is on track to deliver a AAA multiplayer experience with a vision to build a systemic and evolving world focused on freedom, thrill, and playfulness that will keep players entertained and engaged for years.Position - MLOps software engineerWe are looking for an experienced software engineer to join the Generative Machine Learning team at Haven Studios. The ML researchers have been working closely with the game team, and you will play a key role integrating our development with the broader game development pipeline. You will own the architectural design of how we deploy ML to the broader game studio and implementation of necessary systems. You will work closely with the ML researchers and game developers to understand their requirements and build out the infrastructure that matches their needs.ReportingThe MLOps engineer will report to the Director of Generative ML.Responsibilities and DutiesArchitect and implement cloud-native solutions that connect our generative ML technologies to the game (using AWS, GCP)Build CI/CD pipelines to containerize, deploy, version, and monitor our generative modelsImprove development workflows for the ML teamBuild and maintain the REST APIs that expose our ML technology to the development teamExperience and skills requiredCloud platform experience (AWS, GCP, or Azure)Experience architecting, observing, and debugging production distributed systemsExperience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Ansible)Experience with container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)Programming language experience with Python (Go, Rust an asset)Preferred qualificationsGood understanding of Linux and ML frameworks (PyTorch, CUDA )Experience with cloud-based GPUsExperience with distributed training in the cloudComfortable with rapid prototyping, fast iterations—---------Il y a 2 ans, nous nous sommes lancés dans la création de Haven Studios avec une petite équipe et de grandes ambitions. Notre objectif était de construire un studio où nous pourrions créer le genre de jeux que nous avons toujours voulu créer - et auxquels nous avons toujours rêvé de jouer ! Nous faisons désormais partie de la famille PlayStations Studios et nous sommes fiers d'avoir l'opportunité de créer une nouvelle propriété intellectuelle exclusive pour Playstation et de former la première équipe de développement Sony au Canada.Nous avons fait des progrès étonnants en peu de temps grâce à notre équipe talentueuse et passionnée et à ses contributions exceptionnelles. Nous avons instauré chez Haven une culture fondée sur la bienveillance, l'adaptabilité et le courage qui libère la créativité. Notre première nouvelle propriété intellectuelle pour PlayStation est sur la bonne voie pour offrir une expérience multijoueur de niveau AAA, avec la vision de construire un monde systémique et évolutif axé sur la liberté, le frisson et le jeu, qui gardera les joueur·euse·s diverti·e·s et engagé·e·s pendant des années.Poste - Ingénieur·e logiciel MLOpsNous recherchons un·e ingénieur·e logiciel expérimenté·e pour rejoindre l'équipe Machine Learning Génératif chez Haven Studios. Les chercheur·euse·s en ML travaillent en étroite collaboration avec l'équipe de jeu, et vous jouerez un rôle clé dans l'intégration de notre développement avec le pipeline de développement de jeu dans son ensemble. Vous serez responsable de la conception architecturale et de la manière dont nous déployons l'apprentissage automatique dans le studio de jeu ainsi que de l'implémentation des systèmes nécessaires. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe de recherche en ML et l’équipe de jeu pour comprendre leurs exigences et construire l'infrastructure qui correspond à leurs besoins.ReportingL'ingénieur·e logiciel MLOps relèvera du Directeur ML Génératif.Responsabilités et tâchesArchitecturer et implémenter des solutions cloud-natives qui connectent nos technologies ML génératives au jeu (en utilisant AWS, GCP).Construire des pipelines CI/CD pour conteneuriser, déployer, versionner et surveiller nos modèles génératifs.Améliorer les flux de développement pour l'équipe ML.Construire et maintenir les API REST qui exposent notre technologie ML à l'équipe de développement.Qualifications recherchéesExpérience des plateformes cloud (AWS, GCP ou Azure).Expérience de l'architecture, de l'observation et du débogage de systèmes distribués de production.Expérience avec Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Ansible).Expérience avec les technologies de conteneurs (Docker, Kubernetes).Expérience en langage de programmation Python (Go, Rust un atout).Qualifications souhaitéesBonne compréhension de Linux et des frameworks ML (PyTorch, CUDA).Expérience avec les GPU dans le Cloud.Expérience de la formation distribuée dans le Cloud.A l'aise avec le prototypage rapide, les itérations rapides.

title: Software Engineer
description: At Ripple, we’re building a world where value moves like information does today. It’s big, it’s bold, and we’re already doing it. Through our crypto solutions for financial institutions, businesses, governments and developers, we are improving the global financial system and creating greater economic fairness and opportunity for more people, in more places around the world. And we get to do the best work of our career and grow our skills surrounded by colleagues who have our backs.If you’re ready to see your impact and unlock incredible career growth opportunities, join us, and build real world value.The WorkWe are looking for a Software Engineer to join a growing team charged with determining and delivering optimal liquidity for every customer in the world in a cost-effective, robust and scalable manner. You will work closely with applied scientists and other engineers to build robust solutions that power our liquidity services at scale. You will mentor other software engineers, setting and demonstrating high standards and technical excellence. As a member of a growing initiative, you must be passionate about inventing and delivering customer-focused solutions to ambitious and ambiguous challenges.This position can be based in Toronto or LondonWhat You’ll DoBe an entrepreneurial builder, working up and down the stack, mixing software engineering, data engineering, and knowledge of machine learning deployments to jumpstart this new initiative.Deliver reliable, high-throughput, low-latency (micro)services to power-optimized decision-making at scale.Participate in the full software development lifecycle by gathering requirements, leveraging sound software design principles, and ensuring operational excellence with unit & integration testingWork with teams across the organization, including product, design, marketing, integrations, ops, customer success, legal and more Own your solution, from design to production, ensuring the best experience for Ripple’s customers in how they interact with your solutionsContinuously raise our standard of engineering excellence by implementing and driving best practices for coding, testing, and deploymentWhat You'll Bring2-5+ years of hands-on Software Development experience on large-scale distributed systems, with the last 2+ years in Java or similar (Go, C++), experience owning features or components preferredExperience building and deploying containerized applications (e.g. Docker) into modern distributed computing environments such as KubernetesExperience in building transactional systems (preferably in finance, banking, e-commerce domains), backed by scalable data stores and other cloud data services to manage large, structured event data sources such as tick dataExperience with Agile development of distributed services, with a focus on robust software design, scalability and securityEagerness to work openly and collaboratively with a diverse teamAbility to encourage and drive engineering best practicesA positive attitude and a passion for sharing knowledgeBS in Computer Science or similarWho We AreDo Your Best WorkThe opportunity to build in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leadersA learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact. A professional development budget to support other modes of learning.Thrive in an environment where no matter what race, ethnicity, gender, origin, or culture they identify with, every employee is a respected, valued, and empowered part of the team.Ripple is Flexible First: you have the option to work from home, from our offices, or a combination of the two around our centers of gravity (15 global offices).Weekly all-company meeting - business updates and ask me anything style discussion with our Leadership TeamWe come together for moments that matter which include team offsites, team bonding activities, happy hours and more!Take Control of Your FinancesCompetitive salary, bonuses, and equityCompetitive benefits that cover physical and mental healthcare, retirement, family forming, and family supportEmployee giving matchMobile phone stipendTake Care of YourselfTwice a quarter R&R days so you can rest and rechargeGenerous wellness reimbursement and weekly onsite & virtual programmingGenerous vacation policy - work with your manager to take time off when you need itIndustry-leading parental leave policies. Family planning benefits.Catered lunches, fully-stocked kitchens with premium snacks/beverages, and plenty of fun eventsBenefits listed above are for full-time employees.Ripple is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance.Please find our UK/EU Applicant Privacy Notice and our California Applicant Privacy Notice for reference.

title: Data Scientist
description: Position Overview:Here at ShyftLabs, we are searching for an experienced Data Scientist who can derive performance improvement and cost efficiency in our product through a deep understanding of the ML and infra system, and provide a data driven insight and scientific solution.ShyftLabs is a growing data product company that was founded in early 2020, and works primarily with Fortune 500 companies. We deliver digital solutions built to help accelerate the growth of businesses in various industries, by focusing on creating value through innovation.Job Responsibilities:Data Analysis and research: analyzing a large dataset with queries and scripts, extracting valuable signals out of noise, and producing actionable insights into how we could complete and improve a complex ML and bidding system.Simulation and Modelling: validating and quantifying the efficiency and performance gain from hypotheses through rigorous simulation and modelling.Experimentation and Causal Inference: developing a robust experiment design and metric framework, and providing reliable and unbiased insights for product and business decision making.Qualifications:Master's degree in a quantitative discipline or equivalent.3+ years minimum professional experience.Distinctive problem-solving skills, good at articulating product questions, pulling data from large datasets and using statistics to arrive at a recommendation.Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with ability to present information and analysis results effectively.Ability to build positive relationships within ShyftLabs and with our stakeholders, and work effectively with cross-functional partners in a global company.Statistics: must have strong knowledge and experience in experimental design, hypothesis testing, and various statistical analysis techniques such as regression or linear models.Machine Learning: must have deep understanding of ML algorithms (i.e. deep learning, random forest, gradient boosted trees, k-means clustering, etc.) and its development, validation, and evaluation.Programming: experience with Python, R or other scripting language, and database language (e.g. SQL) or data manipulation (e.g. Pandas).We are proud to offer a competitive salary alongside a strong healthcare insurance and benefits package. The role is preferably hybrid, with 2 days per week spent in office. We pride ourselves on the growth of our employees, offering extensive learning and development resources.

title: Data Scientist/Analyst
description: The Hub Program at Client is modernizing its data reporting by improving user experience and introducing internal efficiencies, including the automation of indicator methodology calculations.Our Client's disclosures of health information are made at the highest degree of anonymity possible while still meeting the research and/or analytical purposes. Client publicly releases aggregated data in a manner designed to minimize any risk of re-identification and residual disclosure.Client is endeavouring to automate complex statistical disclosure controls (e.g. small cell-size suppression) to reduce the burden of their manual application, thereby introducing internal efficiencies and improve the timeliness of our reporting.ServicesAssess three statistical disclosure control tools (G-Confid, Tau-Argus and sdcTable) for their ability to meet Client's need to automate statistical disclosure control techniques (e.g. primary and complementary cell suppressions, rounding, etc) for a variety of multi-dimensional, linked and hierarchical aggregate data tables sourcing clinical databases and survey data, with the goal of minimizing disclosure risk while maximizing information utility. Conduct a proof of concept demonstrating the tools' features and capabilities using a variety of aggregate Client data tables, while highlighting how each of the tools could fit into operational data production processes.Write a report summarizing the findings and recommend which among these tools would best meet Client needs. Create plain-language documentation to support the application of preferred disclosure control techniques to aggregate data sets using the recommended tool. Knowledge transfer to support ongoing in-house operational application of the preferred statistical disclosure control techniques for future data releases.Skill or Knowledge Skill Required Skill Level *(Intermediate or Senior) COTS Configuration/Development SAS Macro Yes Intermediate SAS Programming Yes Intermediate Big Data Python Yes Intermediate R Yes Intermediate Leadership / Business Skills Analysis Yes Intermediate CIHI Business Understanding Yes Industry Best Practices/ Trends Yes Intermediate Problem-Solving Yes Senior Process Automation Yes Senior Verbal Communication Yes Intermediate Workflow Design Yes Intermediate Written Communication Yes Intermediate Coaching/ Mentoring Yes Intermediate Other G-Confid Yes Intermediate Tau-Argus Yes Intermediate sdcTable Yes Intermediate
